## Senate one-house bills

-   Senate resolution [R555](https://legislation.nysenate.gov/pdf/bills/2023/R555); introduced March 14, 2023 by Cousins

    -   A summary of how they would change the governor's proposed budget - it describes amendments to many bills that are part of the governor's proposed budgets. Details of their proposed changes are in their amended versions of the governor's bills.

    -   Description of proposed amendments to:

        -   Aid to Localities (S.4003A)

        -   Article VII Transportation and Economic Development bill, S.4003A

        -   Article VII revenue bill, S.4009A, start on p.56 of R555.

    -   History: The governor's bill, as introduced and amended once, was [S.4009](https://legislation.nysenate.gov/pdf/bills/2023/S4009) (Feb 1) and [S.4009A](https://legislation.nysenate.gov/pdf/bills/2023/S4009A) (Mar 6). [R555](https://legislation.nysenate.gov/pdf/bills/2023/R555) (Mar 14) described further amendments, creating [S.4009B](https://legislation.nysenate.gov/pdf/bills/2023/S4009B) (Mar 14) ([landing page](https://www.nysenate.gov/legislation/bills/2023/S4009/amendment/B)). In final negotiations it was amended again - the final bill, [S.4009C](https://legislation.nysenate.gov/pdf/bills/2023/S4009C) (Apr 30), became C.59 of 2023 (May 3).

-   Items

    -   NYC parking fees (S.4008B Part DDDD)

    -   Income tax increase (S.4009B Part LL)

## Assembly

-   Assembly resolution [E190](https://nyassembly.gov/2023budget/2023bills/assembly/E190.pdf) says that the amended bills A.3000-B, A.3001, A.3002, A.3003-B, A.3004-B, A.3005-B, A.3006-B, A.3007-B, A.3008-B, and A.3009-B reflect Assembly proposals.

-   [Report](https://nyassembly.gov/Reports/WAM/AssemblyBudgetProposal/2023/2023AssemblySummary.pdf) on their proposal notes that:

    -   \$1.6 billion increase in all funds budget vs. governor is mainly attributed to \$1.2 billion in Federal receipts from Medicaid and social services.

    -   General fund spending increase vs. governor is largely attributed to \$3.9 billion in new commitments to school aid, higher education, housing, transportation, Medicaid, social services, public protection, and other programs

    -   Assembly revenue proposals described briefly on pp.14-20 of report.

-   Items

    -   **Corporate franchise tax increase**: modify the proposal to extend the current business income tax rate by increasing the current tax rate, by two percent, to 9.25 percent for certain taxpayers with a business income base over \$5 million. Revenue collected within the Metropolitan Commuter Transportation District (MCTD) would support the operations of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA), while non-MCTD collections would support various transit systems within the respective transit region (A.3009B, Part I)

    -   **Personal income tax increase**: Increase the Personal Income Tax (PIT) Rates on Taxpayers Earning over \$5 million: The Assembly includes language to increase the current 10.30 percent PIT rate to 10.80 percent for taxpayers between \$5 million and \$25 million, and increase the current 10.90 percent rate to 11.40 percent for taxpayers over \$25 million. (A3009B, Part DD)

    -   **Apply State and Local Sales Tax to Digital Streaming Products**: The Assembly includes language to apply the four percent State and four percent local sales tax to certain digital streaming products, excluding newspapers or periodicals. Revenue raised from this proposal would be directed to transit systems across the State. (A3009B, Part FF)
